text: Sir John Howe, 1st Baronet (died 1671) was an English politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1654 to 1656. Howe was the son of John Howe of Bishop's Lydeard, Somerset and his wife Jane Grobham daughter of Nicholas Grobham of Bishop's Lydiard. He was given the manor of Compton Abdale, and other estates in Wiltshire by his uncle Sir Richard Grobham. In 1650 he was High Sheriff of Gloucestershire.W R Williams Parliamentary History of the County of Gloucester In 1654, Howe was elected Member of Parliament for Gloucestershire in the First Protectorate Parliament. He was re-elected MP for Gloucestershire in 1656 for the Second Protectorate Parliament. He was created Baronet on 22 September 1660.John Burke A General and Heraldic Dictionary of the Peerage and Baronetage Howe married Bridget Rich, daughter of Thomas Rich of North Cerney, Master in Chancery. Howe was succeeded in the baronetcy by his elder son Richard, who was successively MP for Wiltshire, Wilton and Hindon. His younger son John was MP for Gloucestershire. ==References== Category:Year of birth missing Category:1671 deaths Category:Politicians from Gloucestershire Category:High Sheriffs of Gloucestershire Category:English MPs 1654–1655 Category:English MPs 1656–1658 Category:Baronets in the Baronetage of England
title: Sir John Howe, 1st Baronet
